head.supplied: Draft ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to yr letter of the 8th Instant ¶ addressed to His Excellency the Governor asking to be allowed to select a portion of land lying between Perth & Fremantle on behalf of Mr G...

div.p: Colonial Secretary's Office, acc. 527, no. 345/5, State Records Office of Western Australia, Perth.

Letter dated from the notes on the file and from M to R. Goldsworthy, 26 December 1878. On 25 November 1878, C. D. Price minuted: 'The land asked for by Baron Von Mueller is the Perth Commonage — it is the only Crown Land adjacent to Perth and the Fremantle & Perth Railway will run through it'. On 26 November 1878, Goldsworthy minuted: 'This will, I suppose, be the reply to Baron Von Müeller'. There is a further minute with the same date, probably by the Governor, H. Ord: 'Write to the Baron to this effect'. Draft

In reply to yr letter of the 8th Instant
See M to H. Ord, 8 November 1878. addressed to His Excellency the Governor asking to be allowed to select a portion of land lying between Perth & Fremantle on behalf of Mr Giles to whom the right of selection of 2000 acres was given in appreciation of his services as an Explorer I have the honor in reply to inform you that the land in question is set apart as Commonage for the city of Perth & cannot be granted —
I am likewise instructed to acquaint you that there are not in the country lying between Perth & Fremantle any blocks of land to the extent of 2000 acres available.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
